pageContext.claim: “Well, we're doing background checks [for gun sales]. We already have a lot of background checks. You know, we've done the FixNICS program and a lot of other things, but we're doing some loopholes and we're doing some changes, and I think it's going to be quite good.”
pageContext.analysis: When political pressure rises for tighter gun controls, typically after a mass shooting, Trump usually says he's interested in strengthening federal requirements for background checks. But he invariably abandons those plans later on. Before these remarks, Trump spoke with National Rifle Association chief executive Wayne LaPierre "and assured him that universal background checks were off the table," according to the Washington Post and multiple other news organizations.
